Utterance: Hi, welcome back! It's great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I've been okay. It's been a busy week with my daughter's birthday and everything.
I can imagine! How did the birthday celebrations go?
Oh, it was wonderful! We had a little party at the park, and she loved it. Seeing her happy made all the effort worth it.
That sounds lovely. It's great to hear that you’re finding joy in those moments. Have you had any moments of reflection since our last talk about your mom?
Yeah, I’ve thought about it a lot. I still feel that guilt sometimes, but I try to focus on the good memories we had.
That’s a healthy approach. It’s important to cherish the positive memories while also acknowledging your feelings. Have you been able to talk about your feelings with anyone else?
Not really. I don’t want to burden anyone with my problems. I feel like I should just handle it myself.
I understand that feeling, but it’s okay to seek support. Sharing can sometimes lighten the load. Have you considered talking to your sister or a friend about it?
I haven’t thought about it, but maybe I should. I just don’t want to seem weak.
Seeking support doesn’t make you weak; it shows strength and a willingness to grow. How do you feel about your parenting since we last spoke?
I feel like I’m doing okay, but there are days when I feel overwhelmed. Like, I want to do everything right for my daughter.
It’s completely normal to feel overwhelmed, especially being a young parent. What do you find most overwhelming?
I think it’s just the pressure to provide for her and be a good role model. I want to make sure she has everything she needs.
That’s a lot of responsibility. Have you thought about what "being a good role model" means to you?
I guess it means showing her how to be strong and independent, but also how to be kind and caring.
Those are wonderful values to instill in her. What are some ways you practice those values in your daily life?
I try to be honest with her and teach her to be respectful to others. I also encourage her to express her feelings.
That’s great! Encouraging emotional expression is so important. How does she respond to that?
She’s really open about her feelings. Sometimes it surprises me how articulate she is for her age.
That’s wonderful to hear. It sounds like you’re creating a safe space for her to express herself. Have you noticed any changes in your own emotional expression since you’ve been working on this?
I think I’m getting better at it. I used to bottle things up, but now I try to talk about how I feel, even if it’s just to myself.
That’s a significant step forward! Self-reflection is key to emotional growth. Have you thought about incorporating any mindfulness practices to help with your stress?
I haven’t really, but I’ve heard about it. What do you suggest?
Mindfulness can be as simple as taking a few moments each day to focus on your breath or to appreciate your surroundings. Would you be willing to try that this week?
Yeah, I can give it a shot. I think it might help.
Great! And remember, it doesn’t have to be long—just a few minutes can make a difference. How about we set a goal for you to practice mindfulness at least three times this week?
That sounds doable! I’ll try to make it a routine.
Perfect! I’m looking forward to hearing how it goes next time. Is there anything else on your mind today?
I think I’m good for now. I just appreciate having a space to talk about things.
I’m glad to hear that! It’s important to have that space. I look forward to our next session, and remember, it’s okay to reach out if you need support before then.
Thank you, Ellie. I’ll see you next time!
Take care, and see you soon!
